definition: to bargain/to cut or beat down a price
to chop/to cut down/to throw sth at sb

sentences.english: Chinese tour operators are notorious for bargaining down travel and hotel costs.
sentences.chinese: 中国旅行团因为在旅行和宾馆花费上砍价而臭名昭著。

sentences.english: You can bargain at the market and get a better price.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在市场上砍价，可以砍到一个好价钱。

sentences.english: Many people hesitate to haggle because they don't want to seem cheap.
sentences.chinese: 很多人在砍价上犹豫是因为不想让别人看低自己。

sentences.english: Have you ever think of farmers when bargaining with rice merchants ?
sentences.chinese: 你跟米商砍价的时候，有没有想过农民的待遇？

sentences.english: Committed savers are those not afraid to go for the best deal.
sentences.chinese: 如果你铁了心要做一个节省狂，那就别害怕砍价到底。

sentences.english: Producers therefore bargained with her agent for a lower appearance fee.
sentences.chinese: 演出商纷纷开始砍价，降低天后出场费。

sentences.english: Good hagglers are always upbeat, polite and patient.
sentences.chinese: 砍价好手通常都是乐观欢快，礼貌和耐心的。

sentences.english: A good haggler knows when to walk away empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 砍价好手清楚什么时候空手而归。

sentences.english: Drive a bargain, or you are certain to be overcharged.
sentences.chinese: 要砍砍价，不然你一定会被宰。

sentences.english: Terrified consumer-goods firms have cut costs and slashed prices.
sentences.chinese: 部分公司担惊受怕，于是削减成本和猛砍价。

sentences.english: Good hagglers know few boundaries when it comes to asking for a better deal.
sentences.chinese: 砍价好手知道完成一项更好的交易的界限在哪。

sentences.english: Bring your own ear plugs. Bring your own dental floss. Never pay full price.
sentences.chinese: 带上防噪音耳塞，带上牙线，买东西永远要记得砍价。

sentences.english: She called the destination "a bargain wonderland."
sentences.chinese: 她把这里叫做“砍价乐园”。

definition: to make a counteroffer when haggling/to bargain
to beat down the price/to haggle/to slash one's prices
to bargain/to haggle with a peddler
asking price/to ask a price/to demand terms (in negotiations)
to quote a price/seller's first offer
